ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: holistic survey of cultural sociological theories. a different way of thinking

I gained knowledge about the development of cultural sociology as a distinctive way of studying social life. Important debates surrounding the place of culture in social theory and research were covered, as were the unique contributions of the "strong program" of cultural sociology developed by Professor Alexander and others. I learned important new perspectives for understanding contemporary society in this course, especially the continued power of collective meanings and representations to help shape thought and action in the modern world.
how cultural sociology has developed and the theoretical underpinnings it drew from, internal theoretical patterning of culture
I learned to look at the law like from a cultural sociology perspective, which has been an extremely useful insight for my research.
More understanding of Cultural Sociology, and further comprehension of sociology as a discipline.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course readings and lectures were information-rich and deeply engaging. Section discussion did an excellent job at bringing together the important insights from each week. Incorporating more structured discussions into class could help to further understandings of the material, as would including structured opportunities for student collaboration given the breadth of the material covered.
this class would really benefit from guided reading questions or an outline for lectures
Strengths: the way the course is build up really allows one to fully get the debate

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! learned a lot of things about cultural sociology. very eye-opening.
yes if they are interested in sociology and theories.

I would recommend this course to any students, especially those with an interest in social theory and/or intellectual history. Students from all disciplines can benefit from the arguments discussed in this class, which give powerful new ways of thinking about the social worlds that we all inhabit. Previous knowledge of social theory and intellectual history would be helpful, but not necessary to get the most out of the class.
This is a fantastic class by the most knowledgable teacher in the subject. Amazing class and gained a lot
Yes, I would especially recommend it to law students because I think it provides crucial insights into legal reasoning.
Yes. The instructor is famous and very clear.
